subject: _translate_from_glance() can cause an unnecessary HTTP request
commit_message:
_translate_from_glance() can cause an unnecessary HTTP request

After returning from a get() call to python-glanceclient, nova runs a
translation function on the returned Image to get the data it wants. Part of
this process is checking for an expected set of attributes, one of which is
the deletion time ('deleted_at'). However, if the image has not been deleted,
deleted_at key will not exist. This forces another call to glance to occur for
the same image. A similar problem exists for the checksum attribute, which does
not exist before an image is active. The fix here is to only consider
deleted_at and checksum if they are expected to be present.

Closes-Bug: #1275173

allows the server to return that it already has a copy of the object

subject: Adds support to kickstart diff datastore versions
commit_message:
Adds support to kickstart diff datastore versions

Just like PACKAGES string can be overridden by supplying value via
defining the environment variable prior to running redstack kick-start,
the same facility is now extended to DATASTORE_VERSION string as well.

If the DATASTORE_VERSION is not defined as env var, then the behavior
is the same that would happen without this commit. This commit does
not  alter the default behavior in any way.

USAGE: export DATASTORE_VERSION="-2.4.9"; export PACKAGES=" "; \
       redstack kick-start mongodb

The reason to set PACKAGES=" ", is to prevent the triggering
of Package update at guestagent prepare() time if you are
already prebaking the required version you are interested in,
into the dib image itself. The PACKAGES update at guestagent
prepare() time is partially broken and you may want to avoid
that path to get the desired version of your datastore installed
and instead choose this VERSION string export mechanism

This functionality allows 3 things:
1) Specify the elements for your specific datastore version
   (:eg mongodb 2.4.9) to be picked by dib from an alternative
   location such as for example for mongodb, from
   scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-mongodb-2.4.9 rather than
   the default scripts/files/elements/ubuntui-mongodb when
   no DATASTORE_VERSION is specified. This allows you for
   example to define a different install.d/* element for your
   specific datastore version if it is different from default

2) when redstack invokes trove-manage to register the
   glance image with specific version in trove DB it will
   set the version for eg as 'mongodb-2.4.9'

3) Also if you are taking advantage of dib tools or redstack
   kick-start in trove-integration to build your internal
   company specific image/version of your datastore and
   want to point these tools at your custom elements that
   might be installing packages from custom (non distro
   standard ) repos, then this change allows you to do
   so without impacting the standard behavior and
   conventions for the opensource trove-integration project
   (convention is to support only standard distro repos
    of datastore packages officially/publicly)

Closes-Bug: #1279098
Change-Id: I56d3f6d5706731ab3b499e2629b27dd55b1a5f04

subject: Check object segment MD5s
commit_message:
Check object segment MD5s

Now if a client is downloading a large object and one of the segment
fetches gets bad data, we'll abort the request right away instead of
letting the client carry on. We do this by checking each segment's
body against the etag in the GET response's headers, like we tell
clients to do.

To make sure that the etag is the MD5, we add ?multipart-manifest=get
to all segment GET requests. That way, a segment won't be another
large object, because a large object's etag isn't its MD5. This does
mean that clients can't make, say, a DLO manifest that points to a
bunch of SLO manifests. However, that capability was only introduced
in Swift 1.13.0 (post-Havana); prior to that, clients couldn't mix
large-object types. I'm more than happy to trade that capability away
in exchange for data-integrity checks.

subject: Cancelling thread start while unit tests running
commit_message:
Cancelling thread start while unit tests running

This change modifies the Radware driver and its unit testing code
to not start operations completion thread while unit tests are running.

The driver initialization changed not to start the operations completion thread,
the thread is started only when operation completion item is inserted into the queue
for the first time.
The operation completion functionality was moved to a new function which
is called by the operations completion thread run() function.
The run() function still have the functionality of popping operation completion
items out of the queue and push failed items back.

Unit testing code mocks the operation completion items queue
by calling the operations completion hanler new function when item
is added.

Start() and join() functions of the thread were mocked to do nothing.

All sleep() entrances were removed from the unit testing code.
All unnecessary mock_reset() calls were removed.

Change-Id: I72380bf223be690831aba1fc29c3dca910245516
Closes-Bug: #1245208
